revised_title: Description and Analysis of Gigantic Land-Lizard (Megalania Prisca) Vertebrae from Australia
tldr: The author examines fossilized vertebrae of the extinct Megalania prisca, a gigantic land-lizard from Australia, and describes its unique anatomical features, such as the well-turned hemispheric anterior cup and the contracted neural canal. The analysis provides insights into the size, structure, and habits of this ancient reptile.
